title: Nationals vs. Dodgers weather forecast: Mild with just slight chance of a shower
text:
Originally posted at 4:55 a.m., updated at 10:35 a.m. and 3:45 p.m. to lower rain chances.

Nationals vs. Dodgers 6:40 p.m., Monday, Oct. 7, Nationals Park

A shower is possible, especially in the later innings, but mostly dry weather is looking increasingly likely.

I would not let these rain chances deter me from attending the game, but watch our Twitter feed for updates (@capitalweather).

[How the Nationals make high-pressure weather decisions]

First pitch: 15 percent chance of showers. 75 to 77.

9th inning: 30 percent chance of showers. Near 70.

Chance of rain: 30 percent

Chance of delay: 20 percent

Chance of postponement: 10 percent
description: A shower is possible, especially in the later innings, but mostly dry weather is looking increasingly likely.
authors: Jason Samenow Is The Washington Post S Weather Editor
Capital Weather Gang'S Chief Meteorologist. He Earned A Master'S Degree In Atmospheric Science
Spent Years As A Climate Change Science Analyst For The U.S. Government. He Holds The Digital Seal Of Approval The National Weather Association.
